name: Working / Herding
core_traits: Needs purposeful work and mental challenges
Learns fast; can become frustrated if under-stimulated
High handler focus with strong herding/working drives
enrichment: Daily puzzle or scent game (10–15 min)
Targeting & directional cues (left/right) for fetch or herding-style games
owner_tips: Keep sessions short and upbeat; end on success
Rotate jobs: scent day, trick day, fitness day
Prevent rehearsals of nipping/herding people by redirecting to tasks
notification_short: Plan a job: quick scent game or trick chain to scratch that working itch.
cautions: Watch for over-arousal; add decompression walks
Give structured outlets or they’ll invent their own ‘work’ (herding kids, chasing bikes)

name: Guardian / Protection
core_traits: Natural territorial/guardian instincts
Steady, confident handling needed
Benefit from neutral exposures vs. forced friendliness
enrichment: Calm place training with real-life distractions
Scent searches around home/yard for ‘patrol’ outlet
owner_tips: Prioritize neutrality: reward calm, not over-excitement
Introduce visitors with structure and space
Avoid repetitive high-arousal tug without rules
notification_short: Reinforce calm neutrality: place time + structured greetings today.
cautions: Early socialization matters; avoid overwhelming scenarios
Guarding can generalize—set clear household rules

name: Sporting / Gun Dogs
core_traits: High stamina; people-oriented and eager to please
Often water-loving and fetch-motivated
owner_tips: Balance cardio with brain work (puzzles)
Use scatter feeding/snuffle mats on rest days
Practice polite retrieves and ‘give’ cue
notification_short: Prep a bumper hide or water fetch—work that retrieve brain.
cautions: Watch joints with repetitive high-impact fetch
Prevent resource guarding around high-value bumpers/ducks

name: Scent Hounds
core_traits: Nose-driven; persistence in tracking
Can be independent with selective recall
enrichment: Food scatter hunts and scent trails
owner_tips: Use long lines for safe freedom
Make recall a game with jackpots
Let them ‘clock in’ with daily sniff time
notification_short: Lay a 5-minute scent trail—let the nose do the work!
cautions: Strong scent interests can override cues; manage environment
Prevent frustration barking with foraging outlets

name: Sight Hounds
core_traits: Visual chasers; sprint athletes
Often restful indoors, bursts of zoom outside
enrichment: Safe sprint sessions or flirt pole work
Cozy rest spaces and gentle conditioning
owner_tips: Warm up before sprints; cool down after
Recall practice in fenced areas
Monitor thin skin; provide padded bedding
notification_short: Plan a warm-up + short sprint set; end with a calm cool-down.
cautions: Watch for injuries from sudden turns on slick surfaces

name: Terriers
core_traits: Tenacious problem-solvers; love to dig and tug
High prey/varmint drive
enrichment: Fast puzzles and flirt pole sessions
owner_tips: Channel digging to an allowed spot
Keep tug controlled; reinforce outs
Short, exciting training sprints
notification_short: Set up a dig box or tug-with-rules session to burn that terrier drive.
cautions: Prevent fence-fighting; provide visual barriers if needed

name: Toy / Companion Dogs
core_traits: Bonded to people; can get over-carried (literally)
Confidence building helps reduce reactivity
enrichment: Gentle trick training and platform games
owner_tips: Teach off/on furniture on cue for boundaries
Use tiny treats; keep sessions playful
Dental care early and often
notification_short: Practice two tiny tricks and a lick-mat wind-down today.
cautions: Watch for resource guarding in laps/beds

name: Nordic / Spitz Types
core_traits: Endurance, independence, vocal
Often strong pullers; recall can be optional
owner_tips: Use management for recall; long lines/fenced areas
Work with their love of movement (pulling sports)
Grooming deshed routine
notification_short: Plan an endurance walk or canicross interval; add a puzzle on rest days.

name: Bulldog / Molosser Types
core_traits: Strong bodies; some brachycephalic breathing limits
Often affectionate and people-loving
enrichment: Short, fun sessions with frequent breaks
owner_tips: Exercise in cool parts of day
Focus on calm leash skills & manners
Keep sessions brief; watch for overheating
notification_short: Keep it low-impact today: snuffle work + a short, happy training burst.
cautions: Joint/skin care can need extra attention
